name: Therme București Wellness Day
description: Float in mineral pools, try themed saunas and Aufguss rituals, and lounge under tropical palms at Europe's largest thermal complex. Three zones—Galaxy, The Palm, and Elysium—offer something for families and adults-only relaxation. Prebook online, bring swimwear, and plan for at least half a day to sample pools, slides and spa treatments.
notes: Hours listed by zone; buy tickets via myTherme app or site.

name: Peleș Castle Guided Visit
description: Explore Romania's royal summer residence, a Neo-Renaissance jewel with ornate interiors, armory, and art collections. Join a guided tour to access multiple floors and learn about King Carol I. Check seasonal hours—castle is closed Mondays and Tuesdays most of the year.

name: Bran Castle (Dracula's Castle) Visit
description: Wander the corridors and courtyards of the 14th-century Bran Castle, famous for its Dracula legend and royal collection. Expect narrow stairways, views of the surrounding hills, and seasonal events. Mondays open later; last admission varies by season.

name: Brașov Old Town Walking Tour
description: Stroll medieval Brașov with a local guide: Council Square, Black Church, Rope Street, and old city walls. Hear tales of Saxon merchants and Dracula legends while discovering viewpoints and photo spots around the citadel.

name: Skiing in Poiana Brașov
description: Romania's top ski resort offers groomed pistes on Postăvaru Mountain, modern lifts, and multiple ski schools. Book lessons and rentals in the resort and plan around lift pass options. Great for beginners through intermediates.
notes: Multiple ski schools incl. R&J and Interski.

name: Danube Delta Boat Safari from Tulcea
description: Glide through narrow channels and lakes with a licensed skipper to spot pelicans, herons, and reed islands in Europe's largest wetland. Depart from Tulcea's Port Aval; choose group or private itineraries between April and October.

name: Wine Tasting in Dealu Mare
description: Meet winemakers in Romania's flagship red-wine region. Tour vineyards and cellars before guided tastings of Fetească Neagră, Merlot, and blends. Several estates welcome visitors by appointment and offer terrace tastings with valley views.
notes: Also Budureasca and SERVE offer visits by booking.

name: Transfăgărășan Scenic Day Tour
description: Ride Romania's legendary alpine road past viaducts, tunnels and glacial lakes. Most tours run seasonally when the high pass is open, with stops at Bâlea Lake and viewpoints for photos. Weather can change quickly at altitude.
notes: Seasonal closures typically Nov–Jun at high pass.

name: Turda Salt Mine Underground Park
description: Descend 120 meters into spectacular salt chambers with a subterranean lake, Ferris wheel, and family attractions. Book tickets online or on-site; allocate 1.5–2 hours and dress for cool underground temperatures year-round.

name: Dimitrie Gusti National Village Museum
description: An open-air museum showcasing traditional rural architecture from all regions of Romania—wooden churches, farmhouses, mills, and workshops set in leafy Herăstrău Park. Spend 1–2 hours strolling and photographing historic homesteads.

name: Bucovina Painted Monasteries Tour
description: Visit UNESCO-listed monasteries like Voroneț, Humor, Moldovița and Sucevița on a guided circuit from Suceava or Gura Humorului. See famed exterior frescoes—including the 'Voroneț blue'—and learn about Moldavian history and iconography.

name: Bear Watching from a Hide (Brașov)
description: Head into the forests near Brașov to observe wild brown bears from a secure hide with a ranger. Tours typically last 2–4 hours in late afternoon and run March–November. Silence and dark clothing recommended; sightings not guaranteed.
notes: Operators include Transylvanian Wolf, Observator de Urși.

name: Parc Aventura Brașov Zipline & Ropes
description: Challenge yourself on multiple high-rope courses and long ziplines among tall pines by Lake Noua. Routes color-coded by difficulty suit families and thrill-seekers. Gloves provided; wear sporty clothing and closed shoes.
notes: Located by Lake Noua in Brașov.

name: Black Sea Sea-Kayaking (Mangalia)
description: Paddle the Black Sea coastline near Mangalia on a guided sea-kayak outing. Learn basic strokes, launch through small surf, and explore coves depending on weather. Suitable for beginners in calm conditions; wind and swell dependent.
notes: Operator lists Mangalia HQ; routes depend on weather/sea state.

name: Electronic Club Night in Bucharest
description: Bounce between Bucharest's underground electronic hotspots for a late session of techno, house and indie sets. Expect strong sound systems, rotating international lineups and crowds that dance till sunrise. Dress casual-cool, grab tickets in advance for headline nights, or rock up early for entry.

name: Cluj Live Music & Club Night
description: Catch a headliner or DJ set in Cluj's buzzing venues. Start with a live show, then slide into an after-hours dance floor. The city's students and creatives keep the vibe energetic yet friendly, with events most weekends.

name: Timisoara Club Night
description: Dress sharp(ish) and dive into Timișoara's sleek club scene for chart, electronic and hip-hop nights. Bottle service available but not required; most venues run late with guest DJs most Fridays and Saturdays.

name: Iași Night Out (Bars & Clubs)
description: Sip cocktails in stylish lounges then hit a dance floor in one of Iași's clubs. Weekends bring themed parties, guest DJs and packed dance floors; weeknights skew chiller with live acts and cocktails.

name: Bucharest Escape Room Challenge
description: Race the clock with friends through cinematic sets and clever puzzles in Bucharest's largest escape venues. Choose difficulty and themes, book a private room, and celebrate your breakout with a drink nearby.

name: Cluj Escape Room Adventure
description: Tackle story-driven missions in Cluj with automated props and movie-set vibes. It's a teamwork workout with brainy challenges; great for small groups and corporate teams alike.

name: Bucharest Yoga Class (Vinyasa/Hatha)
description: Reset with an all-levels flow in central studios. Experienced instructors guide breathwork, alignment and gentle strength. Mats provided at most studios; book morning or evening sessions to suit your schedule.

name: CrossFit Session in Cluj
description: Power through a coached WOD focusing on functional strength, conditioning and mobility. Scaled movements welcome—perfect for travelers wanting a serious sweat and a supportive community.

name: CrossFit Session in Bucharest
description: Hit a high-intensity class with certified coaches, barbells and rigs. Visitors can drop into community WODs or book personal training to tune technique.
notes: CrossFit Nord BVS + CrossFit Bucharest venues

name: Oradea Thermal Aqua Day (Aquaparks)
description: Soak in mineral-rich pools, rotate steam/sauna circuits and hit slides if you want thrills. Family-friendly zones and adult relaxation areas make this a great wellness-plus-fun day in Oradea & Băile Felix.
notes: Pair with Aqua Park President Felix

name: Sovata Bear Lake & Spa Day
description: Float effortlessly in saline waters and alternate with saunas and Kneipp pools at Ensana Sovata. Classic balneary treatments are available alongside modern wellness programs.

name: Balvanyos Forest Spa Ritual
description: Hide away in a pine-ringed spa with outdoor hot tubs, thermal circuits and treatment rooms blending wood, stone, water and fire. Ideal for couples or a serene solo reset.

name: Black Sea Coastal Kayaking Coaching
description: Paddle along the Dobrogea coast with a certified sea-kayak coach. Learn strokes, safety and navigation as you explore cliffs and coves when conditions allow. All kit provided; sessions tailored to level.
notes: Operated by Black Sea Paddlers (Mangalia base)

name: Wakeboarding Session near Bucharest
description: Carve Snagov or a private lake on a coached wake set. Beginners get 1-to-1 instruction and safety gear; riders can push tricks with progressive coaching. Great summer adrenaline hit close to the city.

name: Intro to Golf in Transylvania
description: Learn grip, stance and swing on a driving range before testing short game on academy holes. Friendly coaches and calm countryside make this an approachable first step into golf.

name: Romantic Boat Ride on Herăstrău Lake
description: Glide past green isles and city skyline on a private or shared lake cruise. Golden-hour trips are perfect for proposals or a relaxed date; book the classic 'Lăstunul' boat or rent a rowboat/pedalo.

name: Hot Air Balloon Flight near Cluj
description: Lift off for a gentle flight over Transylvanian hills at sunrise or sunset. Share a basket as the pilot follows the winds; land for a celebratory toast and photos.

name: Christmas Market Sibiu (Piața Mare)
description: Wander one of Romania's most charming Christmas markets under twinkling lights. Sip vin fiert, browse crafts and ride the Ferris wheel and carousel. Perfect for families and cozy dates.

name: Christmas Market Cluj-Napoca (Piața Unirii)
description: A festive village in Union Square with local makers, carols and skating. Warm your hands on kürtőskalács and mulled wine between photo-ops at the big tree.

name: Christmas Market Bucharest (Constitution Square)
description: Big city atmosphere with stages, food alleys and artisan stalls in front of the Parliament. Visit evenings for light shows and live music.

name: Christmas Market Timișoara (Victory Square)
description: Wooden chalets, folk music and a Ferris wheel light up the center. Snack your way through local sweets and enjoy nightly performances.

name: Bucharest Traditional Food Tour
description: Taste sarmale, mici, covrigi, and sweet cozonac while exploring Old Town and historic markets with a local foodie guide. Learn dish origins, ordering etiquette, and how to pair Romanian beers and wines. Vegetarian alternatives usually available; small groups keep it personal.

name: Romanian Cooking Class in Bucharest
description: Chop, simmer, and season your own three-course Romanian meal—think ciorbă, sarmale, and papanasi—guided by a local chef. Hands-on instruction covers spice blends, plating, and stories behind classic dishes. Sit down to enjoy your creations with a glass of local wine.

name: Cluj-Napoca Street Food & Market Tasting
description: Sample Transylvanian cheeses, cured meats, chimney cake, and specialty coffee on a guided walk through Cluj's central squares and marketplace. Meet vendors, learn regional flavors, and pick up tips on ordering local favorites.

name: Sibiu Old Town Food Tour
description: Discover Saxon-influenced recipes on a curated tasting route: soups and stews, artisan bread, cured meats, and local desserts. Your guide shares culinary history and modern slow-food projects around Sibiu.

name: Timișoara Craft Beer Tasting Crawl
description: Explore Romania's craft scene with flights at two taprooms. Learn styles from NEIPA to barrel-aged stouts, how to read labels, and what pairs with local snacks. Perfect prelude to a night out.

name: Gramma Winery Visit & Tasting (Iași)
description: Drive into the Bârnova hills for a guided tasting of aromatic whites and blends. Stroll the vines, see the cellar, and learn about Moldavian terroir. Pair with local cheeses or snacks on request.

name: Domeniul Bogdan Organic Winery Tour
description: Visit an organic estate in Dobrogea near Constanța. Walk the vineyard, learn biodynamic practices, and taste award-winning wines in a modern cellar. Ideal summer day-trip from the coast.

name: Dealu Mare Winery Trio (Lacerta/Serve/Budureasca)
description: Spend a full day tasting across three flagship estates in Dealu Mare. Compare styles with a sommelier host, tour barrel rooms, and enjoy viewpoints over rolling hills. Transfers and lunch add-ons available.

name: Constanța Seafood Tasting Experience
description: Feast on Black Sea catch—fried hamsii, rapana, mussels—and Dobrogean specialties with seaside views. Learn what's in season, typical cooking methods, and recommended local wines.

name: Improvisation Theatre Workshop (Bucharest)
description: Loosen up with games that build listening, spontaneity, and storytelling. A professional improv coach guides warmups and short-form scenes—no experience needed. Great confidence builder and social icebreaker.

name: Salsa/Bachata Beginner Class (Bucharest)
description: Learn basic steps and partner connection in a friendly studio. Rotate partners, practice timing, and finish with a short social dance. Sneakers OK; no partner required.

name: Cyanotype & Alternative Photography Workshop
description: Create sun-printed blue images using vintage cyanotype chemistry. Compose botanicals or photo negatives, coat paper, expose, and wash to reveal unique prints. All materials provided.

name: Screen Printing Basics (Bucharest)
description: Design, burn a screen, and pull your first T-shirt or poster print under an artist's guidance. Learn inks, mesh counts, and registration tips, then take home your custom piece.

name: Icon on Glass Workshop (ASTRA Museum)
description: Discover a Transylvanian folk technique painting icons on glass. Trace motifs, apply colors in reverse, and seal your piece to take home. Hosted by craftspeople inside the open-air museum.

name: Weaving on the Loom (ASTRA Museum)
description: Try hand-weaving on a traditional loom, learning basic patterns and warp/weft setup. Friendly facilitators guide you through a small sample you can keep.

name: Romanian Language Crash Course (Bucharest)
description: Pick up essentials—greetings, numbers, food words, and travel phrases—in a fast-paced intro led by a certified teacher. Materials provided; small groups keep it interactive.

name: Specialty Coffee Brewing Class (Bucharest)
description: Dial in your pour-over and AeroPress with a barista trainer: grind size, ratios, and extraction. Practice on pro gear and taste differences across recipes and origins.

name: Barista Basics Workshop (Cluj)
description: Hands-on session covering espresso dialing, milk steaming, and latte art basics at a specialty roastery's training lab. Ideal for home enthusiasts and aspiring baristas.

name: Sibiu Traditional Cooking Class
description: Shop for seasonal ingredients then cook a traditional menu with a local chef. Learn techniques, plating, and regional stories before sharing the meal together.

name: Intro to Romanian Wine (Bucharest)
description: Taste through key Romanian grapes—Fetească Albă, Fetească Neagră, Tămâioasă—while learning wine structure, aroma wheels, and food pairing basics with a sommelier.

name: Sound Bath & Breathwork (Bucharest)
description: Slow down with a facilitator-led session using crystal bowls and gentle breath techniques to release stress and improve sleep. Mats and blankets provided; no experience needed.

name: Halotherapy & Mindful Walk – Turda Salt Mine
description: Descend into the otherworldly chambers of Salina Turda for clean, mineral-rich air. Stroll the galleries, sit in quiet corners for mindful breathing, and enjoy the subterranean lake views.

name: Salt Mine Wellness Session – Praid
description: Ride underground buses to vast chambers fitted with relaxation areas and playgrounds. Breathe deeply during a guided stretch or quiet meditation to benefit from the saline microclimate.

name: Therme Sauna Rituals & Mindful Heat
description: Join a curated series of sauna rituals (aufguss) with scented steam, guided breathing, and cool-down cycles to deepen relaxation. Rotate hot/cold exposure for a meditative reset.

name: Ana Aslan Health Spa Day – Eforie Nord
description: Rejuvenate with seawater pools, mud packs, and tailored therapies at a historic Black Sea balneary center. Combine beach time with a focused wellness session or package.

name: Aqvatonic Med Spa Pass – Eforie Nord
description: Follow a hydrotherapy circuit through underwater jets, cascades, and saunas at a dedicated med-spa by the sea. Family-friendly slots and adult-only times available.

name: Leaota Mountain Horseback Trail Ride
description: Ride calm, well-trained horses across forest tracks and alpine meadows with panoramic Leaota views. Guides match routes to ability; helmets provided. Great nature fix within reach of Bucharest.

name: Bucegi Plateau Hike: Babele & Sphinx
description: Ride the cable car then cross the wind-shaped plateau to the Babele huts and iconic Sphinx rock. A guide sets an easy pace, explains geology and legends, and manages weather calls.

name: Scărișoara Ice Cave & Apuseni Views
description: Head into Apuseni to visit one of the world's largest underground glaciers, then walk to viewpoints over karst valleys. Entrances are managed; guides handle timing and access.

name: Cheile Turzii Gorge Guided Hike
description: Follow a spectacular limestone gorge with suspension bridges and wildflower meadows. Your guide shares geology and local stories, with optional photo stops on scenic ledges.

name: Retezat National Park Day Hike
description: Tackle a classic trail past glacial lakes under jagged peaks in one of Romania's wildest parks. A licensed mountain guide sets pace and route, adjusting to group ability.

name: Viscri Pastures Bike & Haystack Walk
description: Pedal quiet lanes around UNESCO-listed Viscri, stopping for haystack views and village life. Option to switch to an easy pastoral walk if you prefer on-foot exploration.

name: Board Game Night in Bucharest Old Town
description: Grab a table, pick from hundreds of titles, and spend an evening learning new games with friendly locals. Staff help match groups and explain rules, so beginners feel welcome. It's a super social way to meet people and unwind after work in the lively streets of the Old Town.
notes: Bucharest Geek Hub + Snakes & Wizards board game cafés

name: Pub Quiz Night in the Old Town (Mojo & The PUB)
description: Test your knowledge in English-language quizzes with picture rounds, music, and prizes. Reserve a team table, enjoy pub grub and beers, and compete against expat and local teams. Fun, friendly rivalry in two centrally located venues with weekly schedules.
notes: Mojo Music Club (Lipscani) & The PUB Universității host regular quiz nights

name: Escape Room Marathon (Central Bucharest)
description: Race the clock through immersive themed rooms—solve clues, open locks, and crack story-driven puzzles. Choose spooky, fantasy, or thriller scenarios. Great for small groups, team bonding, or date nights. Book back-to-back rooms to turn the challenge into a friendly tournament.
notes: The Void (Pitar Moș 21) & Inside Rooms (Matei Basarab 48)

name: Bucharest Language Exchange Social
description: Practice languages with an international crowd at rotating city-centre bars. Color-coded stickers help match levels and interests. Hosts facilitate icebreakers so newcomers slip right in. A low-pressure way to make friends and keep your speaking skills sharp.
notes: Meetup groups incl. Chatty Elephants & other international socials in Bucharest

name: NOR Sky Rooftop Dinner for Two
description: Clink glasses 136 meters above the city at SkyTower's NOR Sky. Panoramic windows, creative Romanian-inspired dishes, and a moody skyline make it a memorable date night. Book a window table for sunset and linger over dessert as the city lights come on.

name: Rooftop Cocktails at Linea/Closer to the Moon
description: Sip signature cocktails under fairy lights at one of the city's most photogenic rooftops. The vibe is relaxed and stylish, with a busy weekend scene and seasonal pop-ups. Ideal for golden-hour photos and a cozy date above the Old Town bustle.

name: Private Boat Ride on Herăstrău Lake
description: Glide past leafy shores and landmark bridges on a private boat around Herăstrău. Choose a daytime spin or a golden-hour cruise with a bottle of bubbly. Calm waters, city-park scenery, and plenty of photo stops make it a relaxed, romantic escape.

name: Private Snagov Lake Boat Cruise
description: Escape the city for smooth waters and quiet bays on Snagov Lake. Private skippers tailor routes for sunset views, birdlife spotting, or a stop by Snagov Monastery. Add a picnic or prosecco for an elevated date-day vibe.

name: Couples' Photoshoot in Old Town
description: Stroll Lipscani's cobbles with a pro photographer who knows the best murals, courtyards, and golden-hour angles. You'll get edited images for your feed or a keepsake album—perfect after an engagement dinner or as a surprise gift.

name: Edenland Park Zipline & Aerial Courses
description: Tackle progressive aerial routes, giant ziplines, and add-ons like archery or paintball in a forest park just north of Bucharest. Helmets/harness included and staff brief you on safety. Great for families and groups; book weekends in advance.

name: Comana Adventure Park & Kayak
description: Spend a day in Comana Natural Park: tree-top courses, ziplines, boat or kayak in wetlands, and cycling paths. On-site eateries and shady areas make it a relaxed yet active escape. Ideal for mixed-ability groups and families.

name: Tandem Skydiving at Clinceni Airfield
description: Take the leap over Bucharest's outskirts with an experienced tandem instructor. Briefing, harness, and goggles provided; add photos or video at booking. Expect a scenic plane ride, one unforgettable minute of freefall, and a smooth canopy glide.

name: Squash Session & Coaching (Central-East)
description: Book a court or a coaching hour on modern WSF-spec courts. Great cardio, easy to learn, and super social in doubles or mini-tournaments. Equipment hire available; bring indoor shoes. Good for after-work sweat sessions.

name: Badminton Courts & Group Play (Sun Plaza)
description: Fast rallies, friendly ladders, and inclusive beginner training—Badminton Armada runs daily sessions beneath Sun Plaza. Reserve a court online or join coached groups. Rackets available to rent; wear non-marking shoes.

name: Ice Skating Session (AFI Cotroceni)
description: Lace up for open sessions at Bucharest's year-round mall rink. Rent skates on site, loop to upbeat tracks, or book a coaching lesson. Family-friendly with lockers and cafés nearby—great rainy-day cardio.

name: Beginner Archery Class (Sector 5 Range)
description: Learn stance, draw, and release with certified coaches at an indoor urban range. All equipment is provided, and classes suit ages 12+. A calm, focus-building sport that's surprisingly addictive and a great alternative workout.

name: Karaoke Night at Mojo Music Club
description: Grab a mic in Bucharest's Old Town and sing your heart out at Mojo—Romania's original seven-nights-a-week karaoke institution. Multiple bars, a big song catalog, and friendly hosts keep the energy high through late hours. Perfect for groups, meetups, and new friends in the city.
notes: Phone on site; Old Town location

name: Fun Bowling & Billiards at Trickshot
description: Mix games, great music, and a lively crowd at Trickshot's glossy bowling lounges. Reserve lanes for teams, grab craft cocktails and snacks, and challenge friends at billiards and arcade cabinets. A quintessential social night out with easy online/phone booking.
notes: Promenada & Mega Mall locations; phone on site

name: Free-Roam VR Arena & Escape Games (Gateway VR)
description: Step into a free-roam VR arena and cooperative escape games at Gateway VR Studio. Battle zombies, crack Ubisoft-style VR puzzles, or race simulators. Staff guide first-timers, making it perfect for groups, team socials, and birthdays.

name: Immersive Escape Room Adventure
description: Race the clock as a team inside cinematic sets. Choose themes from Indiana Jones to horror at top venues; expect tactile puzzles, hidden mechanisms, and great set design. Ideal for friends or coworkers looking for a shared triumph.
notes: Use either Escape Arena or The Void

name: Romantic Candlelight Concert (Fever)
description: Hundreds of candles, intimate venues, and string quartets covering classical and modern hits. Candlelight events pop up around Bucharest's most atmospheric halls—perfect for a date night with effortless booking and assigned seating.

name: Stargazing at Vasile Urseanu Observatory
description: Peer through telescopes on guided public nights at Bucharest's historic observatory. Staff point out planets, double stars, and seasonal constellations, with occasional rooftop views and exhibits. A quiet, inspiring date option in the city.

name: Boat Ride on Herăstrău Lake
description: Glide across Herăstrău Lake by rowboat, pedalo, or join a mini-cruise. Central docks operate spring–autumn with simple on-site tickets—sunset sessions are especially scenic. A relaxed, wallet-friendly date or friends' hangout.

name: Go-Karting: VMAX (Indoor) or AMCKart (Outdoor)
description: Chase lap times on Bucharest's most popular tracks. Indoors, VMAX Romexpo runs torquey electric karts on a multi-level track; outdoors, AMCKart Tunari offers long straights and night sessions. Arrive & drive or book events for groups.

name: Indoor Climbing Session (Top-rope & Bouldering)
description: Learn knots, belay, and movement on varied walls with rental gear available. Suitable for first-timers or training sessions, with intro classes and auto-belays at leading gyms. Great cross-training and a social way to get active.

name: Laser Tag Battles
description: Fast-paced team matches with vests, scoreboards, and neon mazes. Ideal for office outings or birthdays; most venues offer private games, party rooms, and simple per-session pricing.

name: Padel Court Booking (Romexpo Area)
description: Book doubles at modern indoor/outdoor padel courts near Romexpo. Rackets and balls are rentable; many clubs run beginner socials, ladders, and coaching. Easy to reach from the north side business district.

name: 5-a-Side Football Pitch Hire (South)
description: Round up friends and rent a FIFA-sized 5-a-side pitch with lights and quality turf in the city's south. Book recurring slots, add changing rooms, and optionally hire a referee for mini-leagues.
